rules.title: <context>
rules.abstract: <context> is useful when information is needed to further explain the purpose of a task or to avoid errors. In the name of minimalism, omit <context> as often as possible.

rule.justification: Most tasks do not require an explicit context as the title and <shortdesc> often provide enough information.

rule.rule-statement: Use <context> to explain how tasks might fit into larger user or business processes. Make sure, however, that the information is not specific to a single process, it would make the task impossible to reuse.
Use <context> for notes or warnings that pertain to the entire task rather than specific steps.
